methodPatterns.documentation:
## Summary

Unity calls Awake when an enabled script instance is being loaded.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.Awake.html)

## Summary

Start is called on the frame when a script is enabled just before

any of the Update methods are called the first time.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.Start.html)

## Summary

Update is called every frame, if the MonoBehaviour is enabled.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.Update.html)

## Summary

Frame-rate independent MonoBehaviour.FixedUpdate message for

physics calculations.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.FixedUpdate.html)

## Summary

LateUpdate is called every frame, if the Behaviour is enabled.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.LateUpdate.html)

## Summary

OnGUI is called for rendering and handling GUI events.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.OnGUI.html)

## Summary

This function is called when the object becomes enabled and active.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.OnEnable.html)

## Summary

This function is called when the behaviour becomes disabled.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.OnDisable.html)

## Summary

Destroying the attached Behaviour will result in the game or Scene

receiving OnDestroy.

[Link Document](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.0/Documentation/ScriptReference/MonoBehaviour.OnEnable.html)
